channel.title: Talking to an NPC

item.title: Talking to an NPC
item.dc:creator: @Incognito Incognito
item.description:
@Incognito wrote:

Well look at my other one…

if(NPCID == 1552){ NpcDialogue = 111; NpcDialogueSend = false; }

case 111: talk("It's Christmas! I'm Visiting Veng-Pkers!", 1552); break; case 112: talk("Veng-Pkers has sent me to give a free gift!", 1552); break; case 113: talk("Have some crack and this sled, and MERRY XMAS!", 1552); addItem(6448, 1); addItem(4084, 1); break;

This one works just fine…

Read full topic

item.title: Talking to an NPC
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

There is no choice to bring you to the second message, also NpcDialogue = 124; It’s not set to display any other of those messages.

Read full topic

item.title: Talking to an NPC
item.dc:creator: @Incognito Incognito
item.description:
@Incognito wrote:

Hey, I have made something for my server to talk to an NPC, although, it only brings up the first message.

Here is the code:

case 124: talk("Have you heard?! There will be partyhats soon!", 1283); break; case 125: talk("I will be giving them away, but for a price..", 1283); break; case 126: talk("I'll give you more information on that later though...", 1283); break; case 127: talk2("First I must hide from guards.", "It's kind of a drug deal gone bad.", 1283); break;

And I have also done this code, to make the talking work:

if(NPCID == 1283){ NpcDialogue = 124; NpcDialogueSend = false; }

Any idea’s of why my NPC only says the first message, and not the others?

Read full topic
